Notes on installation and compatibility of Ubuntu on <nowiki>[[http://www.averatec.com|Averatec]]</nowiki> laptops.

== Summary ==

| 2300 Series (HOWTO for the 2370)
| Yes
| These work: ALL COMPONENTS (including compositing for beryl/compiz) 64 bit & 32 bit support in the HOWTO.
| Sleep (not much work put into it)
| v6.10 (Edgy)
| <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2184357|Complete HOWTO]]</nowiki>
| 2007-Feb-20 , <nowiki>[[http://www.dragonfyre13.com|Tim Alexander]]</nowiki>
|-
| 3250 HX
| Yes, boot with vga=771
| These work: Graphics, disk, CPU scaling, networking, USB, sound, wired network, CD burning, hibernate, modem, Wifi (Edgy)
| Sleep (no), PCMCIA (yes, tested with Firewire card), external monitor (yes).
| v5.10 (Breezy) & v6.10 (Edgy)
| Require work: <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=27120|Bluetooth]]</nowiki>, wireless networking (see Details), DVD/RW+ format & write.
| 2006-Oct-26 , <nowiki>[[http://www.fabianrodriguez.com|Fabian Rodriguez]]</nowiki>
|-
| 5500 series
| Yes
| Most things work, video chip is SIS 661FX series.
| Video: there is no DRI support.
| v4.10
| Require work: Wireless networking based on RT2500. See <nowiki>[[http://www.flamingspork.com/blog/index.php?p=338|Stewart Smith's]]</nowiki> blog
| 2005-Apr-20, Cheuksan Edward Wang
|-
| 6100 series
| Yes
| Most Things (Sound, CPU scaling, SIS900, USB)
| Suspend with fglrx and Ctrl+Alt+F1, etc. with fglrx.
| v5.04 (Hoary)
| Require work: Hibernate, rt2500 wireless, tv-out.
| 2005-May-15, Steven Harper
|-
| <nowiki>[[Averatec3700Series|3700 series]]</nowiki>
| Yes
| These work: Sound, CPU Scaling
| Hibernate/Sleep.
| v6.06 (Dapper)
| Require work: xorg.conf settings, rt2500 setup, trackpad configuration
| 2006-May-12 , Thedward Blevins

Other models:
* LaptopTesting/Averatec3225HS-01

== Details ==

Feel free to add additional information here

** Wireless networking configuration
*** Using Windows drivers via <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=9454|!NDISWrapper]]</nowiki> 
*** Using <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/Rt2500WirelessCardsHowTo|native drivers]]</nowiki> or for the 2370, using the rt73 driver from ralink. Included info in the forum howto for that laptop.
